overview: From 2025-10-19 to 2025-10-26, elizaos/eliza had 9 new PRs (9 merged), 0 new issues, and 7 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Make API key setup optional in 'npx elizaos create'
topIssues.author: linear

topIssues.title: pino-pretty errors in export builds from bun - replace pino with adze
topIssues.author: lalalune
topIssues.body:
Our logger is not compatible with the bun binary compilation and build process. Since its built into the core, its very hard to get into and override, so we should rip it out and use a bun compatible logger instead. After some research, I think this is a good option: https://adzejs.com/

We could also just roll our own logging, but then we need color formatting and all that and I'd rather just have something that already works and is easy to drop in.

Please replace pino and all pino-related dependencies with adze and make sure everything works and all tests still pass @claude

topIssues.title: üêõ Build failure in @elizaos/core causing bun run clean to fail
topIssues.author: monilpat
topIssues.body:
## Description

The `bun run clean` command is failing due to TypeScript errors in `@elizaos/core` package during the DTS (type definition) build phase.

## Error Details

### Build Process
```
‚Ä¢ Running build in 17 packages
‚Ä¢ Remote caching disabled
@elizaos/config:build: cache miss
@elizaos/autodoc:build: cache miss
@elizaos/core:build: cache miss
```

### TypeScript Errors in @elizaos/core/src/utils.ts
1. Line 218: `error TS2345: Argument of type '`${string}-${string}-${string}-${string}-${string}`' is not assignable to parameter of type 'never'.`
2. Line 366: `error TS2345: Argument of type 'string' is not assignable to parameter of type 'never'.`
3. Line 409: `error TS2345: Argument of type 'string' is not assignable to parameter of type 'never'.`
4. Line 536: `error TS2345: Argument of type '{ numberOfChunks: number; averageChunkSize: number; }' is not assignable to parameter of type 'never'.`

### Impact
- Blocks `bun run clean` command
- Prevents successful build of `@elizaos/core`
- Affects dependent packages in the monorepo

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Run `bun run clean`
2. Observe build failure in `@elizaos/core`
3. Build fails with TypeScript errors during DTS generation

## Expected Behavior
- `bun run clean` should complete successfully
- `@elizaos/core` should build without TypeScript errors
- Type definitions should be generated correctly

## Suggested Fix

The errors suggest type mismatches in `utils.ts`. Need to:
1. Review type definitions in affected lines
2. Update type assertions or generic constraints
3. Ensure string template literal types are properly handled
4. Fix object type assignments

### Files to Update
- `packages/core/src/utils.ts`

## Priority
**HIGH** - This is blocking clean builds and potentially affecting development workflow.

topIssues.title: Add gitignore to eliza create
topIssues.author: kempsterrrr
topIssues.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

When scaffolding a new agent project with `eliza create` the project does not include a `.gitignore` file, I wasn't checking what I was doing and checked everything into git.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

Please add a default `.gitignore` file to generated projects using `eliza create` command.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

I deleted my git history and created my own.

**Additional context**

<!-- Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here. -->

topPRs.title: chore: merge develop into main
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
Merging latest changes from develop branch into main

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> Introduces a pluggable message service and generateText API in core, unifies server startup/config, adds a Docker/ECS deploy command to the CLI, enables duplicate agent names via UUID-only identity, and improves memory pagination, plugin/character handling, and tests.
> 
> - **Core**:
>   - Adds pluggable `IMessageService` with `DefaultMessageService` and `shouldRespond` logic; centralizes message deletion/channel clear.
>   - Introduces `generateText()` API and refines model types/options.
>   - Adds character utilities (`buildCharacterPlugins`, parsing/validation/merge) and secrets/env loading helpers.
>   - Enhances DB `getMemories` with `offset` pagination.
>   - Extensive tests for runtime, prompts, UUID, character, message service.
> - **Server**:
>   - Unifies startup via `AgentServer.start(config)` (auto-init, port resolution, optional agents), removes plugin/config managers.
>   - Loader now ensures deterministic UUID from name; improves character env secret merging.
>   - Agent update endpoint restarts on plugin changes, in-place updates otherwise.
>   - Memory routes map `channelId`‚Üíagent `roomId`.
>   - Broad test updates (bootstrap autoload, CLI API, lifecycle, socket flow, CRUD UUID).
> - **CLI**:
>   - Adds `deploy` command (Docker build/push to AWS ECR, ECS deploy) with API/Docker utilities.
>   - Adds `tee eigen` wrapper; refactors `start/dev/test` to new server API; improves `create` flags and template resolution.
>   - Removes legacy module/port utilities; updates docs and dependencies.
> - **Plugins**:
>   - Bootstrap: routes message handling through runtime message service; removes legacy provider; improves embedding checks.
>   - SQL: drops unique constraint on agent name (UUID-only identity) and adds migration/tests; supports `offset` in memories.
> - **Client/Examples**:
>   - Adjusts entityId mapping for memories; adds `examples/generate-text.ts`.
> - **Misc**:
>   - Bumps versions to `1.6.2-alpha.26`; updates Renovate config and disables tests for types-only pkg.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 0538c6551724caf8ad746d613ee5adaa06407d48. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

topPRs.title: feat(core): add MessageService interface and default implementation

topPRs.title: feat: Streamdown integration, cross-platform crypto, and server port autodiscovery
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Summary

This PR introduces three major improvements to the ElizaOS platform:

1. **Streamdown Integration (Client)**: Modern AI response rendering with streaming support
2. **Cross-Platform Crypto Utilities (Core)**: Browser and Node.js compatible cryptographic operations
3. **Enhanced Port Autodiscovery (Server)**: Automatic fallback to available ports

## Changes

### Client ()
- **New Dependency**: Added `streamdown` package for AI response rendering
- **New Component**: Created `ai-elements/response.tsx` using Streamdown for unified response display
- **Chat Refactor**: Replaced `Markdown` and `AnimatedMarkdown` components with new `AiResponse` component
- **Styling**: Added Streamdown CSS source to `index.css`

### Core ()
- **New Module**: Created `utils/crypto-compat.ts` providing unified crypto interface for browser and Node.js
  - Supports SHA-256 hashing across environments
  - AES-256-CBC encryption/decryption
  - Web Crypto API integration for browsers
  - Node.js crypto module fallback
- **Settings Migration**: Updated `settings.ts` to use new crypto utilities
- **Buffer Improvements**: Enhanced `randomBytes` to prefer Web Crypto API with graceful fallback

### Server ()
- **Port Autodiscovery**: Automatic fallback to next available port on `EADDRINUSE` error
- **Environment Sync**: Export bound port to `SERVER_PORT` environment variable
- **Host Awareness**: Port availability checks now respect `SERVER_HOST` configuration
- **Error Handling**: Better handling of `EACCES` and other binding errors
- **Logging**: Improved port conflict warnings

## Technical Details

### Crypto Compatibility
The new crypto utilities support both synchronous (Node.js) and asynchronous (browser) operations:
- Browser: Uses Web Crypto API (`crypto.subtle`)
- Node.js: Uses native `crypto` module
- Automatic environment detection

### Port Discovery Logic
1. Attempt to bind to configured port
2. On `EADDRINUSE`, automatically find next available port
3. Update `SERVER_PORT` environment variable
4. Log warning about port fallback

## Testing
- ‚úÖ Client rendering with Streamdown
- ‚úÖ Cross-platform crypto operations
- ‚úÖ Port autodiscovery with fallback
- ‚úÖ Environment variable synchronization

## Migration Notes
- No breaking changes to public APIs
- Settings encryption/decryption behavior unchanged
- Server will auto-adapt if configured port is unavailable

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> Integrates Streamdown for AI responses, adds browser/Node-compatible crypto utilities, and enhances server port autodiscovery with fallbacks and env sync.
> 
> - **Client (UI)**:
>   - **Streamdown Integration**: Added `streamdown` and new `components/ai-elements/response.tsx` to render AI responses; replaced legacy `Markdown`/`AnimatedMarkdown` usage in `components/chat.tsx`.
>   - **Styling**: Included Streamdown CSS source in `src/index.css`.
>   - **Tests**: Added unit tests for `Response` component.
> - **Core (Crypto)**:
>   - **New Module**: `utils/crypto-compat.ts` providing cross-platform hashing and AES-256-CBC encrypt/decrypt (Web Crypto in browser, native crypto in Node/Bun).
>   - **Settings**: `settings.ts` migrated to use new crypto utils.
>   - **Buffer**: `BufferUtils.randomBytes` now prefers Web Crypto with fallback.
>   - **Tests**: Added comprehensive tests for hashing/encryption compatibility.
> - **Server**:
>   - **Port Autodiscovery**: On `EADDRINUSE`, find next free port; export bound port to `SERVER_PORT`; respect `SERVER_HOST`; handle `EACCES`.
>   - **Tests**: Added port availability and fallback tests.
>   - Minor CSP/formatting tweaks and loader cleanup.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit bf226b71667c9047558678d69e01a494a033b854. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

topPRs.title: chore: Code formatting and style consistency
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Summary

This PR applies consistent code formatting across the codebase using prettier/eslint configuration.

## Changes

All changes are **formatting only** - no logic changes, bug fixes, or feature additions:

- **Quote Style**: Standardized to single quotes throughout
- **Line Formatting**: Consistent line breaks and spacing
- **Object/Array Formatting**: Consistent formatting for imports, function parameters, etc.
- **Trailing Newlines**: Added/removed trailing newlines consistently

## Files Affected

- `lerna.json` - Array formatting
- `packages/cli/` - Deploy commands, tee wrapper, tests
- `packages/core/` - Core utilities, types, tests
- `packages/server/` - Server tests and API routes

## Testing

- No functional changes - all existing tests should pass unchanged
- Verified with: `git diff develop...HEAD`

## Breaking Changes

None - purely cosmetic formatting changes

## Type

- [x] Chore (formatting, linting, no code logic change)

topPRs.title: feat: add get action results
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
# Risks
**Low**. This change is purely additive - it adds a new public method to the `IAgentRuntime` interface without modifying any existing functionality. No breaking changes.

What could be affected:
- Plugins can now access action results through a clean API
- Backward compatible - existing code continues to work unchanged

# Background

## What does this PR do?
Adds a public `getActionResults(messageId: UUID): ActionResult[]` method to the `IAgentRuntime` interface and `AgentRuntime` class, providing a clean, type-safe API for plugins to retrieve action execution results after calling `processActions()`.

Currently, plugins that need to execute actions and retrieve their results must cast `IAgentRuntime` to `AgentRuntime` to access the internal `stateCache`, which is not type-safe and relies on implementation details.

## What kind of change is this?
- Features (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- Improvements (misc. changes to existing features - test cleanup)

## Why are we doing this? Any context or related work?
Plugins like workers need to execute actions programmatically and retrieve structured results for further processing. The current workaround requires casting to the concrete implementation and accessing internal cache, which is fragile and not part of the public API.

This PR provides:
- Clean, documented public API
- Type safety
- Encapsulation of internal cache implementation
- Better developer experience for plugin authors

# Documentation changes needed?
My changes require a change to the project documentation.
- API documentation for `getActionResults()` method added in code comments
- No external documentation update needed as this is a new API addition

# Testing

## Where should a reviewer start?
1. Review the interface change in `packages/core/src/types/runtime.ts`
2. Review the implementation in `packages/core/src/runtime.ts`
3. Review the comprehensive test coverage in `packages/core/src/__tests__/runtime.test.ts`

## Detailed testing steps
None: Automated tests are acceptable.

All tests pass (33 pass, 0 fail):
```bash
cd eliza
bun test packages/core/src/__tests__/runtime.test.ts
